text: Daniel Jason Sudeikis ( ; born September 18, 1975) is an American actor, comedian and writer. He is known for creating and playing the lead role in the Apple TV+ series Ted Lasso. It won him an Emmy Award in 2021, two Golden Globe Awards and a SAG Award in 2020. ==Career== In 2003, he was hired as a sketch writer for Saturday Night Live and became a cast member from 2005 to 2013. He has appeared on television in 30 Rock, The Cleveland Show, Eastbound & Down, and other shows. In 2009, he was part of the legendary and last episode of Joe Buck Live when Artie Lange, high on Vicodin and whisky, called Jason a " Lucky Pierre" and verbally fought with Joe Buck live on air. This resulted in the cancellation of Joe Buck Live. He played "Schmitty" on It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. He is also known for his roles in the movies Hall Pass, Horrible Bosses, Epic, and We're the Millers. ==Personal life== Sudeikis was born on September 18, 1975 in Fairfax, Virginia. In June 2004, he married American screenwriter Kay Cannon. They separated in 2008 and divorced in February 2010.Additional on January 8, 2018. In 2011, Sudeikis began dating American actress Olivia Wilde. They became engaged in January 2013.Following an unconfirmed claim in , Wilde confirmed the following day in They have a son, Otis and a daughter, Daisy. Sudeikis and Wilde's relationship ended in November 2020. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Kansas Category:American movie actors Category:American screenwriters Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from Virginia Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Actors from Fairfax, Virginia Category:Screen Actors Guild Award winners Category:Writers from Kansas Category:Writers from Virginia
title: Jason Sudeikis
